items.title: Paramount is laying off over 600 U.S. workers in its second downsizing effort in the past year
items.description: Latest round of layoffs follow two waves of cuts last year.

items.title: The LA Clippers are building the future of tech in sports, with facial recognition powering a new fan experience
items.description: Halo Sports and Entertainment CEO Gillian Zucker says consumers don't mind facial recognition—when it's called something else.

items.title: Exclusive: Ex-Meta AI leaders debut an agent that scours the web for you in a push to ultimately give users their own digital ‘chief of staff’
items.description: The founding trio behind Yutori—backed by Radical Ventures, Fei-Fei Li, and Jeff Dean—aims to reinvent how we interact with the internet, starting wit...

items.title: Employee confidence amongst entry-level workers just hit an all-time low
items.description: Entry-level workers are feeling the brunt of economic uncertainty and it’s leading to an overall decline in job confidence.

items.title: Exclusive: Laurel raises $100 million Series C to map where the time goes
items.description: Laurel has raised a $100 million Series C led by IVP, Fortune has exclusively learned. The deal values the startup at $510 million.
